jobDescription: At UCSF Health, our mission of innovative patient care, advanced technology and pioneering research is redefining what’s possible for the patients we serve – a promise we share with the professionals who make up our team.  Ranked by U.S. News & World Report as the number one hospital in California – and among the top five in the country – UCSF Health is committed to providing the most rewarding work experience while delivering the best care available anywhere. In an environment that allows for continuous learning and opportunities for professional growth, UCSF Health offers the ideal atmosphere in which to best use your skills and talents.Department DescriptionThe Pediatric Heart Center is an integrated program of doctors, nurses, and other health care professionals working together to offer comprehensive, patient-centered care to the fetus, infant, child, and adolescent with heart disease, as well as adults with congenital heart disease.Job SummaryUnder general supervision of the Business and Program Development Director the Data & Quality RN Analyst collects, collates, submits and presents clinical outcome data for the Pediatric Heart Center so that the data can become part of national benchmarking and to enable better internal clinical descion making. This position is responsible for the management, analyzing, summarizing, and disseminating quality outcome reports both internally and externally. Additionally, this position will have a clinical care coordination piece and will be responsible for improving communication with outside referring physicians and helping to develop a long-term patient follow-up process.  This position is specifically focused on national reporting requirements for compulsory data submission to National Cardiovascular Data Registry (NCDR), Society of Thoracic Surgeons (STS) and Pediatric Cardiac Critical Care Consortium (PC4).
